name: St. Martin I

locations.description: Pope of Rome, martyred in exile

summary: Martin I was Pope from 649 to 655. He is known for his opposition to Monothelitism and for convening the Lateran Council of 649, which condemned the doctrine. He was arrested by the Byzantine Emperor Constans II, tried for treason, and exiled to Crimea, where he died. He is venerated as a martyr and is the last pope to be venerated as a martyr.
